title: Cytokines Hematopoietic Growth Factors

title: Erythropoietin
caption: Expands erythroid progenitors Produced in the kidneys Acts through the erythropoietin receptor (EPO-R) Antiapoptotic, therefore increases progenitor survival early in erythropoiesis Recombinant erythropoietin (epoetin alfa) used pharmacologically Anemia of renal failure Chemother

title: Thrombopoietin
caption: Constitutively produced in the liver. Binds to the c-mpl receptor (aka TPO-receptor)– ubiquitously expressed – not limited to megakaryopoietic precursors. Stimulates and supports survival of HSCs Major regulator of megakaryocyte proliferation, differentiation, and platelet produc

caption: Mumtu Lalla, MD

title: Patient Case
caption: A 45-year-old woman is evaluated for a 4-month history of night sweats, fatigue, and a 4.1-kg (9-lb) weight loss. Physical examination reveals conjunctival pallor, petechiae, and splenomegaly. Hemoglobin level is 8.1 mg/dL (81 g/L), leukocyte count is 87,500/µL (87.5 × 109/L), an

title: CML: About that Philadelphia Chromosome
caption: Translocation of chromosome 9 and chromosome 22 = Philadelphia chromosome = BCR-ABL fusion protein with Increased Tyrosine Kinase Activity t(9,22) = Granulopoiesis

title: The Morphology of CML

title: Erythropoiesis
caption: Erythropoiesis is the production of red blood cells in bone marrow from pluripotent hematopoietic stem cells. Process is tightly regulated by erythropoietin, iron availability, and other growth factors.

title: Red cell presentation 7th Jan (1) Slide 5
caption: Sinclair AM. Erythropoiesis stimulating agents: approaches to modulate activity. Biologics. 2013;7:161-174. →Colony forming unit-granulocyte, erythroid, macrophage, megakaryocyte → Burst-forming unit–erythroid → Colony-forming unit–erythroid → Proerythroblast → Basophilic erythro

title: Erythroid Maturation
caption: Progressive hemoglobin accumulation and decrease in cell size and nuclear size from proerythroblast to reticulocyte. Red cells are biconclave and 90fl in volume.

title: Red Blood Cell Membrane
caption: RBC membrane is composed of a lipid, proteins and carbohydrates. The lipid bilayer acts as a barrier and maintains- Osmotic pressure difference Cation concentrations Gas concentrations

title: Lipid Bilayer
caption: Rich in cholesterol and phospholipids. Asymmetrical distribution: Outer leaflet: phosphatidylcholine, sphingomyelin Inner leaflet: phosphatidylserine and phosphatidylethanolamine

title: B. Proteins forming cytoskeleton
caption: Protein laminates the inner surface of the membrane Spectrin - Major structural protein Actin Ankyrin -Connects spectrin to Band 3 Protein 4.1 Protein 4.2

title: Bohr effect
caption: Right shift- O₂ unloading in tissues ↑ CO₂ ↑ H⁺ (↓ pH) ↑ Temperature ↑ 2,3-BPG Exercise / high metabolic state Left shift- Hb holds O₂ more tightly. ↓ CO₂ ↓ H⁺(↑ pH) ↓ Temperature ↓ 2,3-BPG HbF

caption: OSMOTIC FRAGILITY

title: Hereditary Spherocytosis
caption: Defect of ankyrin, spectrin, Band 3, Protein 4.2 MCHC increased Increased osmotic fragility Splenic destruction- extravascular Eosin-5-maleimide (EMA) binding test = most sensitive & specific.

title: Case 2
caption: A 16-year-old boy presents with longstanding mild fatigue. His mother reports that “everyone on her side of the family has had some kind of anemia,” but none required transfusions. Physical examination reveals mild scleral icterus with no splenomegaly.

title: Hexose Monophosphate Shunt /Pentose phosphate pathway
caption: Production of NADPH production and ribose-5-phosphate synthesis NADPH keeps glutathione in its reduced form, preventing oxidative hemolysis. Occurs in CYTOSOL NO ATP production
